intro: Cucumeropsis mackennii, commonly known as the Mackenni's cucumber, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and pumpkins. The plant produces small, pale green fruits that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with five petals. It thrives in arid environments and is often found in rocky soils across the western parts of Australia.
